reviews.text:
Happy hour prices $5 for Face Plant IPA from Lost Rhino.
Cheddar cheese sliders for $7, got 3 mini prime burgers we opted just for cheese. Flavorful, juicy, and worth it!
Prime Beef Burger subbed out roasted corn for the tots. $16 Good sized portion, flavorful and cooked to order (med. rare) The Stone Cove Sauce on the burger was yummy.
Seasoned and Seared Sirloin $22 the tomato jalapeno marmalade was chunky and not spicy hot just enough spice to give it flavor. Roasted Red Pepper Grits were delicious. Cooked to order (med. rare)
We were seated at a booth and spent most of our visit feeling neglected. We had to ask/wave over/request the staff to refresh our beverage orders and our food order.
Maybe I misunderstood the concept of this restaurant.
The food was good, the prices were normal for the state of our affairs.

The menu offers a nice variety of options - something for everyone. We enjoyed a Cubano with Kit-tots and an Impossible Burger (best I've ever had!) with a side of Strawberry and Goat Cheese Salad. We loved it all. 😋 Also really enjoyed the way the staff works as a big team to serve you and make the food (while you watch). They all worked so well together and had a wonderful attitude. Will definitely return.

We went here to try out some of their dishes before going to the Chantilly Christmas Market. We had the crab dip and chips, flatbread margherita, cubano sandwich with tater tots and fish tacos. My fish tacos were just okay- not a lot of fish, but more cabbage and other stuffings. The cubano was enjoyed by my friend but she said the tots were nothing to rave about. I thought it had a different taste but we realized it was the catsup- they had a different flavor added to it. The margherita looked good but was soggy when we got it. Taste was better than my tacos I think. Crab dip stole the day!

I stopped in here today for an very early dinner and was impressed.  I'm from Ohio and the restaurant is set up with nearly every table connected to the bar.  They have a happy hour specials that I will post a photo as it seems reasonable to me.  I had the Flat Iron Steak with Roasted Vegetables.  It came with what is shown plus some potatoes.  I asked the to remove the potatoes to drastically lower the carb count.  The strakbwas good, vegetables were very good as was the sauce.    For health conscious people, I asked if they could convert the taco selections to lettuce wrap tacos and they said they could.

It's the first time I hear the term "kitbar," which I assume to be kitchen and bar, and it fits this so well.

The place is cool, modern, and with great table and bar service, excelling at drinking and hanging out with friends with shareable plates, although it's still a nice place to take the family out.

I managed to snag some happy hour sliders, and they were pretty good. Can't vouch for the rest of the menu, but it looks just as solid.

name: NED DEVINE'S IRISH GASTRO PUB & RESTAURANT

reviews.text:
We had a retirement party, with about 100 people, here and I must say it was fantastic!  What a great space for a party.  There is a new chef (only 2 months) "Aaron Stevens" and he is absolutely phenomenal.  The owner "Gordon" is such a nice guy and extremely accommodating.

Everyone was raving about how great the food was and what an incredible spread.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place, especially if you are looking to celebrate a birthday, graduation, or any kind of party.  We are coming back for the live music on Friday night and the DJ on Saturday.  They also have line dancing and trivia. 5 STARS all the way.  Thanks for an incredible time!

Firstly, the front desk attendant greeted us pleasantly and showed us to our table. The ambience was good and these two reasons are the why I’m giving 2 stars. The food was below average. The appetizers (fries and chacos were okay) but the main course items (fish taco, chicken taco, and the Cajun Chicken pasta) were bad. The fish taco literally had a strong and unpleasant odor. When I informed the the person serving us, they said they can’t do anything as that’s how fish tacos smell. I’ve had fish tacos in other places many times before and this is the first time they smelled this way. The chicken taco was missing the pineapple salsa. We requested the pasta to be creamy but it was dry. Overall the place was nice but the food was not.

Ordered To go and the gentleman who took the order was super friendly.  We ordered Fish and Chips, Corned Beef and Canbage, Bangers and Mash and Buttered Pub Pretzel. Wow, you can tell everything was prepared fresh down to the coleslaw. We’ve ordered in the past but there’s definitely an improvement on the way the food was prepared. I loved the way the cabbage was cooked. It’s perfect with the corned beef. Everything is delicious. We have been ordering to go but we are planning to dine in soon.

Came on a Monday night. A good crowd but the place was weirdly quiet. The website has a photo saying “half priced steaks” on Mondays, but they’re actually only “discounted” by $4-$5. They were delicious so no complaints!

This was so cool. Random and had a good time. Drinks were nice, and the platter was Devine.  Our server was okay,  nothing to cheer about. Would like to come back on a sports game night. Space was clean and crowd had some sense.

We ordered Online the curbside service to go, it was terrible they sent an email saying that it would be ready at 5:35 we arrived at the place at that time, select the option I am here 10 minutes passed and nobody came out;  we called to let them know we had arrived and no one answered;  my husband went in to pick up the order, he was inside for 10 minutes asking for the order and nobody attended him, he saw the order on the table and took it and a woman told him that she couldn't do that, my husband told him what happened and she told him he said he didn't care;  an elderly man asked what was going on, my husband told him and the man apologized a lot;  the food is very good but this time it took so long to get our order that the ice cream for our dessert melted and we had to eat it like that, I recommend the food but not the curbside to go service 🙂

The service was good. The food was ok!
We came to celebrate a birthday for a kid but they don’t have any kind of birthday’s songs or activities!!

Got the chicken fajitas House salad fries w/ lemon/strawberry drink
Service and food was great..just a little cool..for the month of December..Server "k" was nice and appreciated

Food was okay but the desert was pretty good, drinks were awesome so special shout out to the bartender. Our server Shireef did his job really well but I believe the Chief is not focused enough or maybe TGI is short staffed. Over all, great experience, love how the manager on duty was focused to understand the things they missed out on. Will come back again because we have Faith in TGI fridayyyy 😊

RAW CHICKEN. That's really all you need to know about this place. Avoid at all costs unless you're into foodborne illness.

Haven't been in years, remembered it being acceptable, but decided to give takeout a shot tonight.

The salad tasted off, the steak was decent (but a bit chewy), and that's where the "good" ends.

The whiskey chicken "strips" were more like popcorn shrimp... the entire appetizer was about the size of 1, maybe 2, chicken tenders from the last time I had Fridays. They were so-so at best.

However, the main attraction, the boneless buffalo wings were absolutely raw inside. See the attached picture for proof. This is unbelievably dangerous, careless, and disgusting.

What's just as bad however was the complete lack of surprise about the situation. They asked to cook them again, which I declined, and I asked for a refund. After several minutes of them leaving me waiting in the lobby for a bit they finally said that I'd get a refund for the item in 2-3 days. No paper trail whatsoever, no manager was willing to come out, no remorse, nothing.

I would bet good money that I won't be getting any refund from them, they made it pretty clear they didn't care and just wanted me to go away which is fine... last time I ever eat at any TGIF, this one or otherwise.

So yeah, avoid this place.

I call and try to get a status of an order. Isabel answers and says “Hello?” I asked if it was subway and she says yes and asked if she can help me and she says no. Reconfirmed twice and she said 3 times in total she won’t help me with anything I am asking about.
Staff was in some other zone not giving proper response. Also there is no veggies and I am a vegetarian so my bread has just onion and bit cucumbers 😄

Nothing special,
Very weak customer service,
I went there, gave the cashier a coupon,  she said it has been used before!
A few minutes ago I just had cut it from a typical Subway coupon sheet!

This Subway location was very disappointing. Employees were very unwelcoming. They did not have Swiss cheese available. The soda dispenser did not have ice. Ice was in a bucket right next to it. I don't plan on coming back.
I order a steak sub, i asked for some xtra cheese but there where not cheese . Also the meat was kind old, not warm enough. And the vegetables they we’re kinda old. Not happy at all!!

Overcooked chicken which didn’t taste like Parmesan crusted chicken, buns for my sons burger were like hockey pucks, fresh fruit was great, chicken tenders overcooked and dry. Definitely not worth the money they charge which was $50.00.

Stuffed chicken was good, burger wasn't bad, fish and chips was good, chicken tenders were dry and bland. The server was GREAT, and had a great personality...however service was very slow because he was by himself manning the bar AND the bar tables, on a Sunday night when the NFL is playing. I think they need to make sure they have enough people working, especially on nights that are typically busy.

Been a long time since I come for Lunch here (Pre-Pandemic)  I an my lunch mates were HAPPY AND PLEASED at the serving size which matches the cost per meal PERFECTLY.  Everyone at the table cleaned their plates.  I one of my Friends HIGHLY recommend the Beer Battered Fish and CHIPS incredible perfectly cooked and the side salad excellent compliment.

Do be patient when visiting.  They are short staffed wait times will be long but SO WORTH IT.  Service was excellent as well.

Food was awesome & so was the presentation! I had the Steak breakfast with orange juice. It's attached to Crown Plaza hotel so to walk down to get an amazing breakfast was EVERYTHING TO ME! FOOD IS LIFE LOL The waitress was so nice even though I wish she would've did at least 1 check up on us as we ate. I'm serious about customer service but I'm ok because the hotel/restaurant manager actually came & was greeting & checking up on everyone! Very rare for hotel managers to come talk to the guest! I really enjoyed everything about this restaurant!
Ruben was delicious. Fish and chips were great and the slaw was excellent!

Neat little spot with a decent menu. The employees/maybe owners? were pleasant and helpful. I was elated as the food exceeded my expectations. Ordering was a breeze and the food didn't take long to come out. I really enjoyed the shrimp.

Delightfully friendly Mediterranean restaurant serving up amazingly delicious food!! You must stop in if you're hungry and in the area. Sooo good! On top of the delicious food, the atmosphere is delightfully trendy and classy, and the staff are some of the most friendly people I've ever met!
It was a very quiet Tuesday afternoon, but by the time we were leaving it was starting to pick up. Great food for a reasonable price! Just what we needed after a long day!

This is a nice "little hole in the wall" under the arch at Clocktower. The food was delicious, reasonably priced and a nice atmosphere overall. The service was pleasant, despite there being no table service. I would return in the future.

I did a carryout recently and was very impressed with how good the food was. You wouldn't think it from the outside but this place had delicious Chicken and Ground Beef Kabob with Rice, and the Lamb chops 🥩 were cooked spot on 👌 The presentation and tastiness of the sauces, rice and seasonings on the meat was just perfect. This place is legit and I will definitely be back for more!

When you first open the Resturant door , a clean smell flows toward you - fresh- woods smell . Everything is in tip top shape from the door to the tables to the bathrooms.
The food itself tastes clean . Very excellent preparation, every cook is on top of his performance. The food was just lovely • tasty that you would think you were in another place like Japan itself . The owner has taken his cooking trade • experience • love of color • crispy texture and gives you moments of true food enjoyment
The owner is a wonderful person who takes time to sit w/ you , talk w/ you as well

Great sushi spot in the Herndon area. I ordered for pickup and the wait time was a reasonable 20 minutes. Their indoor dining seemed great with pretty decor.

The host was nice and patient as he got my order and rang me up for payment. Although the sushi is pricey (as usual), it was all delicious. Highly recommend the shrimp tempura! I appreciated that they included silverware and napkins with my takeout order :).

Ignorance is bliss. This was my favorite place. One of my favorite appetizers is the Potato Shrimp. Recently when I tried to order it, I was informed the supplier is out of stock. It is a sad day when it is too hard to peel a potato into the shoe string and then wrap it around a shrimp and fry it. I wish that this was my only issue.

My second favorite appetizer is the Tuna Stack. Who doesn’t love Tuna. Well when I ordered it, it was much different than the previous times I had had it, and it did not have cucumbers like the menu stated. I looked through other photos posted, and the Tuna Stack has gone through many iterations, but I don’t think the menu has ever been updated to reflect the changes nor variations. This a BIG deal consider allergies. You can’t advertise one thing but present another. People can get sick or worse. Tuna stack this was not. There was more filler than fish. From what I could make out, tasted more like radish variant than pear.

I ordered the Super Rainbow Roll because it had double the fish. As you can see in the picture it just looks like a regular rainbow roll. Consistency and quality is lacking.

Lastly, when I arrived I was told I had to wait which is totally understandable. While waiting a group of four arrived and said they had a reservation. The lady at the front scoffed with a sound in response and then walked away. The group was eventually seated. When it came time for me to be seated, I looked around there were 6 seats at the sushi bar, 4 tables, 1 large table, and 2 booths open. In the time that I had been waiting, only 4 people had left.

Though we have ordered from this place multiple times for pick up and delivery, this is our first time dining in for a late dinner. Place is super clean, very calming, the staff is very attentive and excellent customer service. Food is very good. Ramen is on point, Japanese style chicken curry was delicious, siomai was also good and to top it off with fried ice cream and hot green tea was perfect. We will be back.
So far so good. Sushi spot, we had a great experience here he waiters were extremely nice, attentive and friendly. Nice spot. Clean and we will return. Sushi was amazing as well.

Absolutely disgusting customer service. We found plastic in our food, when brought to the managers attention, (Karla F) she shoved me off.  She stated they work with plastic it wasn’t their fault. I stated I just wanted another bowl, they wouldn’t give us another. Easily resolved with just being given another bowl, however it didn’t seem “fit” for them.

I placed an online online. I went 10 minutes past my estimated pick up time. Still wasn’t ready. Kid’s Meal… all i asked for. Served poorly. The oil was dripping out of the foil creating a mess in the bag. The rice & beans portions were served very small compared to what they usually serve on a kids meal tray. They didn’t give me my chips & juice. Y’all can do better.

The workers at this specific location are extremely rude I must say. One of the worker accidentally added sour cream after me saying no sour cream she didn’t bother to apologize nor re-made my order. With my husband’s order when he asked for more corn she got rude and said if you want more take it as side and you have to pay extra. I don’t mind paying extra but I don’t believe chipotle has ever charged extra for wanting one ingredient more than other while ordering veg burrito bowl or charged less if I don’t want few ingredients!! They didn’t even gave us time to get rewards. Being nice to a customer doesn’t cost you anything.

Chipotle is one of the best foods i had and that will be one if my default option when i am confused about what food to eat. I really like their options for bowls. Chipotle staff has been very nice and friendly where ever i go like in a different state or so.

Ask they guy to warm up each tortilla separately and he denide. He said the tortilla was warm enough that was his job and if I would like to touch the tortilla. Not the customer service anyone should be getting.
Terrible service the one lady serving customers with an attitude, why do I have to take an attitude when I’m spending my money in your business, complete bs!
Customer service was so awful!! So des respectful

Please get your staff interviewed for mannerism. They shouldn't treat customers with arrogance, definitely not selectively based on skin color. I don't recall her name but this lady is fair skinned, short and pulpy - if you want to take any corrective action.
There are so many well mannered and good looking people out there with no jobs. Give them a chance.
Decent shop, location. If you don't mind listening to the same 4-5 songs played over and over (and over).

literally order online so I don’t have to deal with employees and even then I get an attitude while picking up. wonder if the young lady with dark red hair gets paid at all or is just there as a punishment

Pretty nice Thai restaurant. The staff was in a bit of a rush because I arrived 20 minutes before closing. I ordered fried rice with veggies and tofu. The portion was pretty large and it tasted great but there was very little tofu - as in half a dozen pieces. The sticky rice with mango on the other hand was perfect. They forgot to bring my Jasmine tea but at least they didn’t try to charge me for it. All in all it’s a good restaurant and maybe the experience would have been better if I had arrived earlier.

If you’re looking for the best local Thai food in Fairfax County, it’s Nan Thai. As you walk in, you’ll be greeted by the attentive crew. Their menu is great, prices are reasonable and the serving size is always generous. Thanks you guys for always taking care of our Thai food cravings. You all rock 🔥

The atmosphere was really great at this restaurant! They were very accommodating for our large party of 8. The staff were so friendly as well.

The food was so delicious and the portions are big so I got to take some home too! I would definitely recommend this place to everyone I know.

Another Nova Thai flop for the books:

It was a beautiful day for a date with my wife. It's like unwinding after a long week at work. This restaurant is conveniently located near an AMC theater, making it a nice choice for a quick snack before or after a movie. That's exactly what we did.

My personal experience with Thai food in Northern Virginia has been mediocre at best. And this eatery did not disappoint us. All of the dishes we ordered seemed to have a lot of brown sugar or teriyaki sauce in them. We requested level 4 of their spicy scale, which ranged from 1 to 5, with 5 being the hottest. Our dinner was as sugary as McDonald's soft serve ice cream.

If that's one of their hottest items, I can't imagine what their mild food tastes like. I'm not sure why they bother asking what level of spice I want if they're just going to smother the food in sugar. Isn't it normal to ask for spicy and get it?

We split the zebb wings and basil bomb. Wings were not bad. However, Basil Bomb was a huge letdown. We didn't like the combination of chewy squid, dry-ish shrimp, and strange sauce. It was supposed to come with fish, but none were found. On the plate, our fishing method was unsuccessful!

There was a lot of Basil leaf, as the name suggests, but for some strange reason, we didn't smell it much. You should be able to smell it from miles away based on the amount of Basil leaf on the item, but sitting 1 ft away from it, we failed; or rather, the item failed us.

Perhaps the food is suitable for Caucasian tongues, but not for those from Eastern Asia. Another flop for Nova Thai!

Ambience, taste of food and the customer service is great! One of a kind garlic chicken wings, crab fried rice are our favorites. If you like spicy food, try Taj Mahal fried rice. Party of 5 can expect 15% tip automatically charged in the final check. Car parking easy near the restaurant. Must visit Thai restaurant in herndon area.

The place has so much fun for ages 3-12. Our birthday party guests had an amazing time. We were so grateful to our birthday host Ariana. She was extremely nice generous and great with the kids. The birthday party packages are wonderful. Thanks for an amazing time
One of the best places to have birthday parties for your kids. Tasty pizza and games. Package deal with all you can play card for 2 hours.

This Chuck E Cheese has good management and great customer service. The place doesn't get too crowded and gets sanitized on a regular and the bathrooms are clean. The salad bar and veggies are fresh and the pepperoni and cheese Pizzas were great. Good place for birthday parties with affordable packages and lots of fun games.
My kids and I had SO much fun here! Very clean! The manager is so friendly and incredibly helpful. This was our first time and we will definitely be back again very soon.

This place is just amazing! We had our son’s birthday party here and it was a super hit! Our birthday host Hajra and the manager were so friendly and helpful! Hajra was on top of everything and made sure the party was super fun but also organized. Hajra along with the manager and other staff set up a ton of other extra decor stuff that we brought in with us. There were 22 kids at the party and every single one of them had a blast! The place was super clean, we saw someone from the staff sanitizing everything every half an hour or so. Overall an awesome experience! Thank you Chuck E Cheese Herndon for making my son’s birthday celebration a really great one!

The food we ordered was delicious and the presentation was good. We didn't get thrown together sandwiches as some places have done. We would have given 5 stars if the subs were a bit bigger (even if it was just a few dollars more). Definitely worthwhile ordering food from here.

I ordered an Avo Turkey sandwich, which is supposed to come with turkey, avocado, and cucumber. I added pickles, mayonnaise, and provolone to the order. I recieved a sandwich with only turkey, pickles, and mayonnaise. No avocado or cucumber, which comes with the Avo Turkey sandwich. No cheese. 3/6 ingredients that I asked for, 2/3 ingredients are supposed to come with the sandwich. Not impressed.
Best and tasty sandwiches, clean place, helpful staff.
Good food decent value. Easy to order online for pickup.
Sent me email with a BOGO code, then they were the only location in the area to close their online ordering 2 hours before closing

This McDonald’s always get Oder wrong or they don’t put what we paid for in the bag I’m just giving away free money I guess…. And when I try to call someone picks up the phone that doesn’t speak English at all and they hang up because they don’t understand English I mean it is an American restaurant right… And when I ask for light sauces on a sandwich it ends up being drenched in sauce… is there not communication there with cook?  I mean how hard is it to look at the screen and make sure what I paid for is in the bag?? The food is soggy and the lettuce is brown I take mayo off it’s still to much.. Does this look like light mayonnaise!

Worst branch in Virginia bad employees not respectful and not clean they are not doing there work and don’t were gloves and there are insects everywhere. Hopefully Macdonald close this bad branch. I don’t recommend for all of you buy from this branch.
Worse McDonald's in the area. Always slow and there's always something wrong with the food. How can you even think this is close to  being cooked
This location was not able to take my credit card payment. I had to walk out without my Big Mac. I was very disappointed. I will try again next time I drive by this shopping center.

McDonald’s customer service bar is SO LOW, but this location can’t even maintain that. It doesn’t matter if there are only a few cars, you will spend at least 5-10 minutes in the drive thru and THEY WILL get your order wrong.

Well well at 11 pm anything is better than drive thru stuff. They have a smaller menu after 10/11pm and the variety is actually good stuff. They have the full bar menu and service also reduces to 2 to 3 servers.
All in all loved their artichoke dip and boneless wings which were basically popcorn chicken.

Decent place to hangout and have a few drinks. Nice bar staff is the main complement I can give.

I understand they close early at 10PM at their Herndon location but they still keep a bright sign outside on that says "kitchen is open late", which is very misleading. I would not recommend this Herndon location because it closes so early. If you plan to leave early, it may be OK but there are many other better options nearby.

Tried the “That’s my Jam burger which should come with a bourbon jam, my burger lacked which was the main feature.. the jam. The other burger ordered was the bourbon BBQ burger which also lacked the bourbon bbq sauce. Both burgers were really read in the center, i like pink but red like suspect as if the staff may be rushing to push orders out. The third dish ordered was the French onion soup which tasted amazing, however the plastic bowl was less than half full which didn’t match the price of $11. My first experience of Bar Louie, which was a bummer. $55 worth of food was a disappointment unfortunately.
The food was great & the waiter was brilliant. We really enjoyed the atmosphere & would go there again.

It was a rainy Thursday night and we were just in time to enjoy happy hour.  Great deals and options.  I recommend stopping in.  The service was pleasant.  The pretzels with cheese were yummy!  Really everything except the flat bread were enjoyable imo. I'll be back.  The vibe was mellow and quiet but it was really early, so 4 stars on atmosphere.

reviews.author_name: Archbishop Dr Smith Abrams Almasi MDiv DD THD PhD
reviews.text:
Excellence. QDOBA MEXICAN EATS is outstanding. Great atmosphere. Lovely for Family dining and entertainment.

I give a thumbs up, and a five star rating to the establishment. Kudos to a wonderful, hard working staff. Great job. Teamwork makes the dream. Join them and enjoy your meal. They also offer pickup and delivery service to your door.

We usually enjoy their burritos but yesterday’s Mexican rice that was added in the burritos was crunchy (uncooked) which ruined both our chicken adobe and steak burritos. We were dissatisfied and disappointed.

Update: I am raising my rating from 2 to 5. Qdoba's customer service reached out to replace the two meals with credits for future entrees. I redeemed one today for a chicken burrito and the rice was much better.  Service was nice too.

I've been a loyal customer since the Worldgate location open it's door. My family and I often grabbed food for lunch/dinner. Enjoy the rewards program. There is a lovely lady who's worked there nearly as long as they have been open. In the past 3 years or so, we have experienced more rudeness with a couple of employees. One the most recent (about a month ago) 2 female employees refused to speak to me in English, they would only communicate with my husband (he's latino). We ordered the same thing we always do (had even ordered it from the very lovely work not more than a week before) but these 2 ladies REFUSED to fulfill the order. My husband and I left. I did report this through the survey however the only response I get is there standard "sorry this shouldn't have happened" bs and an offer for 2 free meals. I don't want 2 free meals, I want to know something is being addressed with these 2 ladies. As I told corporate this is NOT the first time they have mistreated myself and I have witnessed other customers mistreated by them. I just keep getting a stock "we are sorry" email. I refuse to go back to Qdoba until this addressed. If that means I never eat there again, so be it!

Ordered the taco salad with impossible meat, both beans, roasted tomato sauce, lettuce, fajita peppers, guacamole, and pickled onions.  Came with maybe a tablespoon of impossible meat, no beans, no roasted tomato sauce.  Basically a shell full of lettuce.  Won't be going back.

QDOBA has some great food!!! I had met some sweet kids at the movie theatre next door and offered to treat them to a meal. They picked this place. I loved my burrito, it was very good! They loved their quesadillas and one of the kids got a burrito too. They were saying it doesn’t compare to their mother and father’s home cooking (they were Spanish ethnicity) however they said it is good. Service was good.. but I will say one thing. While one of the kids was going to get napkins, she said an employee asked her “Do you know him?” Referring to me. She said she just ignored the employee. I guess the employees were “looking out” for the kids, since the kids looked really younger (they were ages 7-12) and most were female.. but the kids didn’t ask for help and they didn’t look like they were in danger. So why ask that? They were sweet kids who returned a $50 bill I dropped at the theatre. A lot of kids would have taken the 50 and ran.. They were talking about how they were hungry but didn’t want to eat the movie theatre food SO I wanted to treat the sweeties to a nice meal as thanks! Whoever raised them did right!! Next time don’t ask questions like that to someone, unless they look like they’re in trouble. There are still good folks out there, believe it or not! Herndon and beyond.. the world is full of em!

Giving 1star for friendly employees. Ever since I saw an ad for Mexican Street Corn salad, wanted to try it. So, finely a couple of days ago I ordered on my app, Mexican Street Corn Salad for me and Penne Rosa for my wife, to go. I went and brought my order home. My wife’s Penne Rosa was fine. But, I got very disappointed to open & see my Mexican Salad, look at the picture and you’ll see why I say that. I must mention that I didn’t want any meat or tofu in salad. It’s a regular size bowl and it didn’t have any avocado or cilantro. It had very little feta, cheddar tortilla strips, tomatoes or roasted corn. This was my first time ordering from this location and now last.

This location is awesome. Friendliest staff I’ve seen at this franchise locations. The cashier clerk advised me to try the new lean guini I took his advice and it has now taken over as my favorite dish. Will drive extra time to visit this location specifically.

We have Bering going there for a long time now. Both my kids love it. The food is always good, service is prompt and people are friendly.
It’s a go-to place for my kids for a quick meal.

I come here once and a while. This evening was an exception, I wanted noodles. I normally order the Pemme Rosa, which is also good and had a kick off spice that really hits the spot and make the taste bud tingle. In any case, I entered and was greeted right away with a boisterous "Welcome to Noodles." It was quite surprising and welcoming at the same time, but it put me in a good mood to order something different. I ordered the Pad Thai with the parmessian crusted chicken. I didn't wait long and I sat down and ate. The dish was really good and week worth the choice. The rice noodles were booked right and the mix of line pieces, peanuts, sprouts was really a orchestra of good food. Ever since the Noodles and Company crossed my path of the lunchtime routine, I was convinced this was a great option over other fast foods easy. The variety of Japanese, Korean and other Asian recipes is a good combination for success amongst a crowd of hungry customers. It can be pricey, but it really depends on the individual on how they will quench their appetite. For me, it can be two to three times a week that I am a patron, but I don't have to convince myself about the flavor and overtake taste of the food.

I'm here now. First time ever I've been at a noodles & company in my very long life. The manager's name is Aaron. He should be the employee of the year. He's patient, informative, asked if I wanted a cup for my bottle of water that I had. Gave me a sample. I had no idea that the stuff wasn't nuked. Both of us got the stroganoff with steak. Mine had plenty of meat in it and plenty of the other meat, meaning mushrooms. the lid on the side with all those dark pieces in it is most of the mushrooms I picked out and gave to my companion.

my meal did not come piping hot so I asked if they would heat it up thinking they would nuke it, he happily did. But they don't nuke it, they fry it. I'm very happy with this place. With the amount of meat in it, the noodles were good, not overdone.
People came in after us, and the kid wanted buttered noodles with chicken hold the seasoning. The father wanted some dish and put the chicken on the side and heat it up. People! Stop making substitutions.
I rarely rarely give five stars. you can look back through all my 427 reviews and see that. This place deserves it and so does Aaron.

name: Starbucks
vicinity: Village Center at Dulles, 2465 Centreville Road, Herndon

reviews.text: This Starbucks is so weird.  Just getting inside you have to navigate the seemingly always preset UN convention of people loitering outside. It’s like some sort of weird Nigerian refugee camp or something.  Waiting to pick up my order the staff made no attempt to tell me they were running behind and working on my Togo order.   Then the barista made wise cracks about my name.   I do not have an unusual name.  Never going back.
The people are nice, not crowded during evening time, as usual the cappuccino is great.

I stop by here every time I’m in the area when I’m craving a sweet beverage. To say that service or quality is consistently great, it’s not. BUT, I find this location very convenient as it has a drive-thru. I jump on the occasional beverage trend and try different drinks once in a while, but generally my go-to is a refresher or caramel Frappuccino (extra caramel, don’t judge me). Be warned the line can get super long in the blink of an eye so make sure you’re not in a rush because there’s no way to get out once you’re in line. I’ve also tried some of their breakfast sandwiches and pastries, but I’d have to say the iced lemon loaf is by far my favorite. Overall, nice and friendly staff. I plan to keep supporting the business provided they continue to make improvements on a consistent basis.

BIG Corporate coffee machine failed this morning. BIG meeting and only smaller Keurig  machines which for big meetings don't work fast enough. I call Pablo, he says NO PROBLEM, be ready in 20 minutes. Took my name, I arrived, coffee was ready, paid, and they helped me take 3 boxes of coffee to my car. GREAT GROUP OF YOUNG PEOPLE at Starbucks Village Center @ Clock Tower. THANKS TO ALL WHO HELPED ME! I will call again, you are the best.

Top Notch Customer Service!

On this particular day, at this particular time, I am very pleased with this visit. Despite one of the drinks (Salted Caramel Mocha Frappe) having a taste that wasn't quite right, the Barista cheerfully made a replacement that was perfect!👌🏾 Very good Starbucks!🏅🎉

I have been trying Kalpasi since 2016 in Herndon Area, food never disappointed us. Our favorites Mutton Biryani, Naan, Chicken lollipops! Chettinad style dishes are tasty! When we visited around 12:15pm there is no crowd on weekend. Restaurant is clean and they are taking a good safety precautions during pandemic 👍🏻

By far the worse Indian restaurant to have been in decades.  I have lived in DC metro since 1972 and went to this place tonight with a friend who has visited the restaurant before and recommended it.  The decor is mediocre at best but the goat curry was the worse piece of meats I have ever had in my life! See my photo of the leftover fast and skin. Hardly any meat for $16. I am South Asian decent who cooks many desi  dishes  all the time including  goat curry. This was just plain bad. The waiter gave us water bottles without asking and charged which I asked him to reverse.  Why not provide tap pitcher ice water we are not in Europe or India. The plain naan I ordered never came out until I had to ask after dish served. The main dish came with our appetizer when we asked them after appetizer.  The waiter was very very inexperienced and zero clue on American dining.  None of the dishes came with serving spoons and plate was not given during appetizer.  This is a minor league amateur village restaurant at best.  I’ve had better meals at refukar kebab place. Never again, patrons  in DC area have so many options especially in northern Virginia.

Kalpasi appears to be good only for the Veg/non veg entree, as for multiple occurrences never had issue . But the recent take out experience from the restaurant had been terrible.
Ordered a ‘Mutton Biryani’ and ‘Chicken 65’ . The biryani rice was clearly overcooked with excess water. It was sticky, mushy and had oil as well.
The chicken 65 was just deeply fried chicken which appeared to be burnt. (Check attached images) . There was no garnishing of cilantro , curry leaves etc which is not how Chicken 65 should look.
Both the dishes appeared to have been cooked in hurry .
When contacted the restaurant, the manager says that is their specialty when mentioned the rice is like that and looks sticky.

Would not order again any biryani or any fried food from this restaurant again.

Convenient location, excellent customer service and good food. Food was hotter
than my expectations. Pomfret fish fry is a must try.  Overall super satisfied with the food.
Tasty and authentic South Indian cuisine, but don’t expect top notch service.
Excellent place to enjoy a nice meal without leaving the hotel!!!  Clam Chowder, Chicken Cobb, and Humus with Naan bread.
Flight cancellations led me to the Westin for less than a night. Padella was a good dinner for a weary traveler. Good food and good service.

Best olives I have tasted in a long time. Fell in love with them in Europe and kept trying them here to meet in satisfaction every time till I tried them here. Loved the blackened chicken sandwich and asparagus soup as well

It’s a hotel restaurant. I had breakfast here. Food was okay, typical American breakfast. One of the staff called Sebastian picked up something from my hand without warning, violating my physical boundary and when i try to talk to him about that he just walked away. This is rude, disrespectful and unprofessional.
This place is underrated, was hesitating to come earlier. Very taste food, reasonably priced.

Dropped by for some bagels, and the lady who took the order is just wonderful. We got what we want plus an extra cream cheese to go. Sorry forgot to ask her name, we appreciate your good customer service.

It’s a pretty good panera location. Their self-order machines were broken with two of them not accepting any of our cards for payment, not even NFT phone payment. We had to order in person instead.

The food came in a timely manner and their coffee/drink bar was clean on a Sunday morning. Their coffee does not taste that great, so I would recommend getting a latte here instead. Their morning breakfast items are plenty, and would recommend the chicken ciabatta.

Quick, fast, and filling. I ordered from in restaurant and the order was perfect. Food was good, not five star restaurant quality, but filling and better than traditional fast food. Panera is always a quick shoe in when you are in a rush.
Just stopped in for a quick pick up order. Friendly, attentive staff, clean area, and fast service. Parking is challenging but that's typical.

This was the worst Panera experience of my life. The salads on both of my you pick two orders were all wilted lettuce with enlarged soft, stale, and bready croutons. There was no lettuce in one but just chopped chicken bits. The other salad had black pieces on the tips of the lettuce. The Frontega chicken sandwich was literally two tomatoes and a small piece of chicken missing all the spinach and arugula. What a joke for a sandwich. The cream of chicken and wild rice soup was all liquidy not the thick consistency it is supposed to be but worse it was just pieces of rice only in this liquid mess. WORST PANERA EVER. This place needs to close down. Hire people who actually put in the effort to do a good job or fire them.
